preparing for an initial public offering in the second half of this year. The timing will depend on market conditions, Chrysler's financial results and its ability to refinance the government loans, Sergio Marchionne said. Because of these changed market conditions as well as the improvements in our performance and outlook, made possible through the support of the U.S. and Canadian governments, Chrysler intends to repay these loans in full at the earliest opportunity, Sergio Marchionne said in today's statement. January 2011 10:01 AM I do love the pious attitude of the left on this subject, I remember a time when they were only to happy to jump into bed with Rupert Murdoch and the Sun! Although this story was easily refuted, you would expect the future chancellor to be pretty miffed about it. And yet it is said that George Osborne himself suggested Andy Coulson as the Govt's director of communications. Amazing kind-heartedness on the part of a man not generally known for such qualities.
